meaningMnemonic: If a <radical>grain</radical> seems extra <radical>heavy</radical>, you know it's a different <kanji>kind</kanji>. Not all <kanji>type</kanji>s of grains are the same. So when you feel the heavy type, you know it isn't the same as the light kind.
readingMnemonic: You sort all of the different <kanji>kind</kanji>s and <kanji>type</kanji>s by putting them in the right <reading>chu</reading>tes (しゅ). They slide away, probably to some big type-based piles you can't see.
